Momocs
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Layered shape and multivariate plots with grindr
  • News

Cross-tabulates objects

Simply extends base table for a more convenient use on $fac slot.

table(...)

# S3 method for default
table(...)

# S3 method for Coo
table(...)

# S3 method for Coe
table(...)

# S3 method for PCA
table(...)

# S3 method for LDA
table(...)

Arguments

...

a list of, first, a Momocs object (Coo, Coe, PCA, etc.), then, column names in the $fac slot. If not specified, returns a table on the entire $fac data.frame

See also

Other handling functions: arrange, at_least, chop, combine, dissolve, fac_dispatcher, filter, mutate, rename, rescale, rm_harm, rm_uncomplete, rw_fac, sample_frac, sample_n, select, slice

Examples

table(olea, "var", "domes")
#>         domes
#> var      cult wild
#>   Aglan    60    0
#>   Cypre    30    0
#>   MouBo1    0   60
#>   PicMa    60    0
table(olea)
#> , , view = VD, ind = O1
#> 
#>         domes
#> var      cult wild
#>   Aglan     1    0
#>   Cypre     1    0
#>   MouBo1    0    1
#>   PicMa     1    0
#> 
#> , , view = VL, ind = O1
#> 
#>         domes
#> var      cult wild
#>   Aglan     1    0
#>   Cypre     0    0
#>   MouBo1    0    1
#>   PicMa     1    0
#> 
#> , , view = VD, ind = O10
#> 
#>         domes
#> var      cult wild
#>   Aglan     1    0
#>   Cypre     1    0
#>   MouBo1    0    1
#>   PicMa     1    0
#> 
#> , , view = VL, ind = O10
#> 
#>         domes
#> var      cult wild
#>   Aglan     1    0
#>   Cypre     0    0
#>   MouBo1    0    1
#>   PicMa     1    0
